catalog_info.title: Introduction to African Studies
catalog_info.notes: Required of concentrators in African Studies track. This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Societies of the World.
catalog_info.description: This course introduces students to the general outlines of African archeology, history and geography, as well as key concepts in the study of African health, social life , economic situation, arts, and politics. Our aim is to give students a fundamental vocabulary and interdisciplinary methodology for the study of Africa. Throughout, we assume that Africa is not a unique isolate but a continent bubbling with internal diversity, historical change, and cultural connections beyond its shores. The course is open to all students who are interested in exploring various dimensions of African life and cultures in ancient and modern periods.
